hook.text: Capitalism lifted billions from poverty and created billionaires who own more than nations. It does both at once.

buildup.text: Capitalism means private ownership of production, free markets, and profit as the primary incentive.

discovery.text: After 1800, capitalism drove explosive growth. Global GDP increased 100-fold in two centuries.

twist.text: Capitalism generates inequality as a feature, not a bug. Returns to capital outpace returns to labor over time.

climax.text: No pure capitalism exists. Every capitalist country uses regulation, welfare, and state intervention to manage it.

punchline.text: Capitalism creates wealth unevenly. The debate is how to share it fairly.

quiz.question: What drives wealth creation under capitalism?
options: Private ownership, free markets, and profit incentives
